Module HW05
Package view

Class View<TStrategyDropListItem,TPaintDropListItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • view.View<TStrategyDropListItem,TPaintDropListItem>
  • Type Parameters:
    TStrategyDropListItem - The type of the items put on the update strategy drop lists.
    TPaintDropListItem - The type of the items put on the paint strategy drop lists.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class View<TStrategyDropListItem,TPaintDropListItem>
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The View class is the specific instance/extension of the JFrame class that we are using to create our desired GUI window.
    Author:
    Peter Dulworth (psd2), Sophia Jefferson (sgj1)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Adapter that the view uses to communicate to the model for repetitive update tasks such as painting.

      • View

        public View​(IV2MControlAdapter<TStrategyDropListItem,TPaintDropListItem> v2mControlAdapter,
            IV2MUpdateAdapter v2mUpdateAdapter)
        Constructor that creates/initializes the frame.
        Parameters:
        v2mControlAdapter - adapter from the view to the mode that handles control.
        v2mUpdateAdapter - adapter from the view to the model that handles updating.

    • Method Detail

      • initGUI

        private void initGUI()
        Method that initializes the GUI window and its components (created through WindowBuilder). Paints shapes based on the button and has a text field that can be toggled with a button.
